name: Cancer Research
description: Multi-agent coordination across cancer research domains. Agents explore data, analysis, and hypothesis layers to discover cross-domain connections.

0.label: Genomics
0.description: Gene mutations, sequencing data, BRCA, TP53, variant analysis

2.label: Clinical Trials
2.description: Trial results, phase data, patient outcomes, dosage records

4.label: Epidemiology
4.description: Population data, incidence rates, risk factors, demographics

5.label: Pharmacology
5.description: Drug compounds, mechanisms of action, toxicity profiles

6.label: Patient Records
6.description: Anonymized outcomes, treatment histories, survival rates

7.label: Microbiome
7.description: Gut flora, bacterial influence on treatment response

10.label: Immune Response
10.description: T-cell behavior, checkpoint inhibitors, immunotherapy patterns

11.label: Biomarker Correlation
11.description: Linking markers to outcomes, predictive signatures

12.label: Resistance Mechanisms
12.description: Why tumors stop responding, adaptation pathways

13.label: Cross-Cancer Patterns
13.description: Similarities between cancer types, shared vulnerabilities

14.label: Treatment Sequencing
14.description: Optimal order of therapies, timing effects

15.label: Side Effect Analysis
15.description: Quality of life impact, risk-benefit trade-offs

16.label: Genetic Pathways
16.description: Signaling cascades, pathway disruption, network effects

17.label: AI Diagnostics
17.description: Machine learning on imaging, early detection models

18.label: Novel Combinations
18.description: Untested drug combinations suggested by data patterns

19.label: Cross-Domain Links
19.description: Connections between unrelated fields — the unexpected bonds

20.label: Unexplored Pathways
20.description: Biological mechanisms nobody is investigating yet

21.label: Repurposed Drugs
21.description: Existing drugs that might work for cancer — hidden potential

22.label: Personalized Protocols
22.description: Individual treatment plans based on genomic + lifestyle data

23.label: Prevention Strategies
23.description: What if we could prevent it? Early intervention ideas

24.label: Microbiome Therapy
24.description: Using gut bacteria to enhance treatment — frontier research

25.label: Synthetic Biology
25.description: Engineered organisms targeting tumors — radical approaches

26.label: Emergent Insights
26.description: The center cell. What emerges when all domains converge.

0.name: The Floor — DATA
0.description: Verifiable facts. Papers. Results. Hard evidence.

2.name: Mod 27 Zone — HYPOTHESIS
2.description: New ideas. Untested combinations. The frontier.
